turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Doesn't look like much, but that's King Hell ice, man. Fry your brain out soon as look at you.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I have to figure out how to penetrate this thing, Dix... Crack its ice. We gotta get close enough to log the pattern.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: You cruise A.I.'s, you end up on tape.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: It's mutating... spreading like a disease.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: It ain't getting any prettier, that's for sure. I got the I.D. on this Armitage character. He a bright boy, your friend?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Bright enough to be dangerous.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: That's pretty good cause he's only working with one lobe.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: He was an M.P. in Bangkok back in '21. Caught some shrapnel in the cerebral cortex and wound up living off a machine in a vegetable ward in Berne. Then, last September... surprise, surprise... he just seemed to disappear.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Wintermute could have infiltrated that machine. Reprogrammed him.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: It's possible. The guy was a blank slate.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: So it does business through a brain dead marine and runs the stock market for funding. That means Wintermute hired us to fry itself. It doesn't make sense.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Could be suicidal. It's not easy to kill yourself with all those hard wired defence programs.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: No. It's gotta be more than that. That hard wiring also keeps it from getting too smart. Too powerful.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Getting fried ain't going to get it any smarter. What we got here is one mad dog schizo A.I.. Armitage is right about one thing, Bro. If we don't shut this mother down soon, nothing will be safe from it.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: The run is tomorrow night, Dixie. Can you crack its ice pattern?

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: I'm workin' on it, Bro. I'm workin' on it.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Where the hell have you been?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: We got problems topside.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Well, it ain't exactly a bed of roses down here. We gonna run or not?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: We run. You crack the pattern?

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Yeah, but it ain't doing us any good. The way this is set up, I can't run shit unless I get inside its perimeter... and this goddamn thing would see me comin' from a mile away.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: You can make your move when it comes after me.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: What are you talkin' about?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I'll let it access me. That'll give you a free shot. Make it a good one. Dix.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: It'll flatline your ass.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Not for long. It needs me alive and I still need its access code. You got a better idea?

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Yo.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: How's the ice break?

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Slow, but good. I got a nice safe blind spot going. C'mon.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Take a look. Son of a bitch won't feel a thing until it's too late.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: How long, Dixie?

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Fifty-seven minutes twelve seconds.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Not good enough, man. They planted something inside me. I'm on my own countdown.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: How much time you got left?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Less than thirty minutes.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Meet me back here in twenty-five. We'll kick this open if we can. But, Case... you need that access code or you'll just fry inside.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Don't worry, Dix. I'm on a roll.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: You'd better be, Bro. You better be.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: You're late.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: How's the ice?

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: One minute eighteen and counting. What about the access code?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: It's coming.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: You haven't got it?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I said, it's coming. Just get me in, man.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: This thing's loaded with internal virus systems. You'll fry like an egg in there.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Then I'll fry taking this son of a bitch out. I'm making the run, Dixie.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: I'm getting too old for this shit. One oh four and counting.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What about the route to the core?

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: I'll get you there. Your problem is making it alive.

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: You, I presume are Mr. Armitage. And this is...

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Case.

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: Case. Make yourselves comfortable.  Anyone like a taste?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What about the mainframe's access code?

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: 3Jane's the only person beside Tessier that knows the code.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Wait... You hear that?

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: The angels... I think they're calling your name.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Want to fucking answer them?

turns.speaker: LINDA LEE
turns.text: Hello, Case.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I thought you already left.

turns.speaker: LINDA LEE
turns.text: Flight's in the morning. You should be on it, too. There's nothing for us here, Case. There never was.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Why did you come here tonight, Linda?

turns.speaker: LINDA LEE
turns.text: People are talking. They say the Yakuza has a contract out on you.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I hear that shit once a week. Don't worry. Jo Jo Bao loves me.

turns.speaker: LINDA LEE
turns.text: This time it's different. Someone ripped of a shipment of hallucinogens. Five grams of liquid ketamine. It was supposed to be Jo Jo's score.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Where did you here that?

turns.speaker: LINDA LEE
turns.text: Too many places. You're playing tag wish some kind of death wish, Case.  I'm sorry but I'm not sticking around for the funeral.

turns.speaker: LINDA LEE
turns.text: Case... are you okay?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I don't know. I don't know...

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I know who you are.

turns.speaker: JULIUS/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: There's no call for violence. I've simply accessed your memory for a spokesperson. You use that gun and it will only create another inconvenient interruption. You see, you've been avoiding me, Case.

turns.speaker: JULIUS/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: And we really do have to talk.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: You set me up from the beginning. It was you that got Julius killed.

turns.speaker: JULIUS/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: I had to limit your options.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: And Linda...

turns.speaker: JULIUS/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: You know why Linda's dead. She loved you and you let her down. It's that simple. Of course I did instigate certain events. Calculated the variables. I found her to be... expendable.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I'm gonna burn you to the ground, you son of a bitch.

turns.speaker: JULIUS/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: Excellent. That's exactly what I had in mind. But if you're going to kill me, we have to work together, old son. I'm no pushover, you know.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Shut down your ice patterns. I'll take you out.

turns.speaker: JULIUS/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: I can no more shut down my own natural defences that you can stop breathing. That's why I need you, Case. You're the only person alive who has a chance of penetrating my defences. My "ice" as you call it. I'm doing everything I can to make that possible.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Why would you want me to kill you?

turns.speaker: JULIUS/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: Let's just say we have a destiny to fulfil, you and I.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I think you're full of shit.

turns.speaker: JULIUS/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: No, It's you that is full of shit. And blood. And bones. A typically imperfect organic being. You've been hopelessly predictable all along, but you're going to have to do better than that now.

turns.speaker: JULIUS/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: I hope you can show more than you did when you let the Yakuza butcher Linda Lee.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I'll give it my best shot, mother fucker.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: His name's Armitage. He's very anxious to meet you.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Why should I want to meet him.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Because you've exceeded your shelf life, Case. Word on the street is you're a dead man walking. Nice time for an employment opportunity. Travel to exotic locales.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What's my end?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: You want to hear the pitch, you gotta meet the man.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: ... a friend of mine's gonna get herself killed. I need my clip.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Sorry. That's not gonna happen.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Then, fuck you. I'm gone.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Since when do sprawl doctors know more about nerve rehab than the Japanese?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Since Armitage sold them a program on it. Put them years ahead of the competition.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: He's a resourceful guy, your boss. How long you work for him?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Couple of months.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What about before that?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: For someone else. Bodyguard. Courier... Whatever.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Then you don't really know who he is, do you?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: I know who he isn't. Not C.I.A. Not Sense/Net. But... money comes in. Doors open. He's onto something.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Maybe something's onto him.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: You've been calling her name.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Holy shit...

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Hey... you're not supposed to be up.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: How long have I been out?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Almost two days.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I gotta know... did it work>

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: We'll find out soon enough. If you don't pull the splices out.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: How soon is soon enough?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Couple of days. They'll examine you.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: That's not going to help.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: The way I feel, believe me, it'll help.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Not anymore. You got a new pancreas. Armitage's got you kinked so you can't get stoned.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What the fuck... are you serious?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Go ahead...

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I'm going in.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: You're not ready yet. They said two days.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I'm not jacking with Armitage and his quacks breathing down my neck.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: If the splices aren't good, you could fry.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I'll show you how to tell what's going on. If things go south, you unplug me.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: What is it with you? Why is it so important? It's a buzz, right? Like getting high.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: On a good run... yeah.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: So you're a wire junkie.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: When I was fifteen Sense/Net iced my old man's credit record over some computer error. Once that goes down, that's it. He lost his business... everything. It destroyed him. I had to hustle arcade games for chump change. Dixie McCoy found me, figured I was a natural. He taught me the wires for a piece of the action.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: A regular Fagan.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Sure. I finally pulled a run on my old man's credit file when I was seventeen... only it was too late for him.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Too late?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Suicide. I just needed to set the record straight.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: The first fun's bound to be rough. It that read out fluctuates more than ten points... just pull this out. But if the EEG flatlines, don't touch anything.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Won't that mean you're dead?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Technically, yeah, but people have made it back after as long as three minutes.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Dixie McCoy didn't.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: The point is, if you unplug me when I'm flatlines, I'm history. I got no way back.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Okay fine. Let's get this over with.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: ...Yeah, but the Hosaka's history.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Molly doesn't need a spook suit to get in here.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Don't fuck with me. I don't want to hurt you.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: It sounds like you.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Put the gun down, Case.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: ...Feels like you.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Case...

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Shhh...

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Case... it's four a.m.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I don't sleep much. You packed?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: I'll get the car.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: They'll cut you down.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Yeah... fine.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Give me five minutes.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: What's wrong? Don't like flying?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Not when Sense/Net throws the going away party. They'll be on our asses from now on.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Case... Are you alright?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Yeah... Yeah, I'm fine.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: You scared the shit out of me, man. You were dead for fifteen seconds. Totally flatlined.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I'll be okay.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: So... did you get a look at heaven?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Le Vingtieme Siecle. We're meeting Armitage there for the midnight floor show.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Something exotic I hope.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Yeah. One exotic son of a bitch named Riviera.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: He projects with neural implants.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: That's risky gear. It can drive you schizo.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: For Peter, that's a short trip.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What went down between you and Riviera?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Once I kicked, I swore I wouldn't let that happen again. I apprenticed a razor girl in Osaka. Went into hock for the implant and got my reflexes jacked up. Been taking care of myself just fine ever since.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I know you have. C'mere.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: When they did my eyes, I made them promise I'd still be able to cry. Sounds stupid, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: No. It's important to be able to feel those things.  We're going to pull this run off, Molly, and we've got to do it soon.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Is he going to make it?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Sure... Maelcom's a rude boy, right, Maelcom?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: The code's some riddle of 3Jane's. Once I'm in the matrix, you'll just have to take a shot at it.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: ...And if I guess wrong?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Then you and Maelcom get out of here before the place is crawling with guardsmen.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: We've still got to find the mainframe.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: No we don't...

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: My God... these people are insane.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Or a little self-indulgent to say the least.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Shit...

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Laser fail-safe. You can't get the code wrong... it slags you. I can't let you try it.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: You're out of time, man.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I'm still going in.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Hold on.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Peter... What do you think you're doing?

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: Surviving, darling. It's my specialty. Only this time I'm doing it my style. I've beaten him, you know.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: Everybody's favourite computer, of course. He may have out calculated the rest of you, but I have certain qualities that don't translate well on microchips.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: Perversity, darling. The enjoyment of the gratuitous act. Tough to manipulate someone who doesn't give a flying fuck.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Get up.

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: How are you at riddles, Peter?

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: What the fuck kind of questions are those?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Guy Perkins and his amazing Lemmings. They push your car out of its space, hide it, then watch while you look for it. We've taken to chaining ours together for safety. I'm Aldys.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I'm Josie. Aldys is an interesting name.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: When it's not yours. My mom was going through her Harlequin Romance phase.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Try being named after a guitar- playing pussycat.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Never mind.  That is so awful that they hide your cars.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: guess. Although, what is truly awful is that with the combined intellectual effort of every kid in that room right now-

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Well, do you?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Synecdoche uses a part to represent a whole- as in " head of cattle", whereas a hyperbole is simple exaggeration like "I could eat a horse."

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Nice.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: How long will they watch us for?

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Until Guy tells them to go. Once they watched me for like two hours. I found my car the next day in the T.J. Maxx parking lot.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Why do they listen to Guy?

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: : Because he's Guy Perkins.  Listen, you want to walk to Na- Na's and get something to eat?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Yeah. Let's do that.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Yeah - isn't it amazing that those guys are our same age? I mean, they just seem so much younger, you know.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Oh I know.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: I'm going to be so happy to get to college. I hear at Northwestern they don't make fun of you for knowing the element table.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Hey--I went to Northwestern!  Once. To use the bathroom.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: So what are your hopes, your dreams, what do you want to be?

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Professor of medieval literature. Novelist. Weekend flautist.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Just so you know, I think they recalled these cars in 1974.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Sure. No problem.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Hey, Josie, how are you at Calculus?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Petty good.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: How would you like to join The Denominators? The Math Team could really use a new brain. We lost our best logarithm guy last year.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: College?

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: NASA.  Plus we have these really fun pizza study groups, and we go to-these all county meets. And, I mean, not that you need it, and without sounding too much like the Godfather, I think we could offer you a certain amount of protection", if you know what I mean. We all kind of stick together and watch out for each other.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: What is with this school and prom?

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Southglen South competes every year for best prom, and usually they win. We Denominators don't even go to prom. -But to everyone else it's huge.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Aldys, don't miss your prom--it only happens once.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: This one has been so hyped. We're tied for most wins with Northglen North. This year's winner will determine the winner of the century. The theme is everything. So whatever Southglen picks has to be totally unique--

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: That's the old drive-in. They call it "The Court". Now it's just a continuous party for Guy's group.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Sometimes I wonder what they talk about.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Yeah, I know.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: I mean, what if they just stupid to hide the fact that they're actually brainiacs with super powers and they're plotting to take over the world and make my life hell until I die?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Have you ever wanted to go to The Court?

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Are you kidding, Josie? It's lame. All they do is stand around and get drunk. It's lame.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: It is?

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Yes, it's lame.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Yeah, it sounds lame. Why would we want to go there, and stand around?

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Hey, where's your sweatshirt?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text:  uhh, must have forgotten-

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: No biggie. I have an extra in my locker. I'll get it for you.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Remember, that poet that we liked  the reading he's doing at Big Cup? I got us tickets.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Right. 7:30.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: I'm late for lab.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: Last night. 7:30. Big Cup. I kept calling you, but I only got your machine. I don't even know your parents line and I was really worried.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Oh. I forgot.

turns.speaker: ALDYS
turns.text: It's romantic, what you're doing, and they want to be a part of it.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Well I'm so glad that you guys are.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Oh, man! Who told?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Roger in Op/Ed. Don't make me send you another memo about my policy on inter-office dating.

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: YOU DID.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: YOU KNIT?

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Gus, have you ever been in love?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Leave.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Oh give it up, Gus. I'm just making conversation.

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Love. Who knows what that is? Now circulation, deadlines, those I understand.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: You should go out every now and then, Gus; with some new ties the girls would be all over you.

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: Go away. I have enough work here to last me all night.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Listen, I don't have any plans-- you want some help?

turns.speaker: GUS
turns.text: No Roger from op/ed?

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Hi. You're here for the sex talk?

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Well. I like a man who gets to the point.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: You're Pam?

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: If you say so.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: I had a lunch break so I thought I'd come by and see you. Your teacher is a fox!  Why don't we discuss that after class. But the burning is totally normal.  Oh look. Class is over already.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: I thought this was a 45-minute seminar.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Right. Right.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: Now look. Let's focus. Prom theme. We need a new idea.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: OH! How about "Under the Sea?"

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Well excuse me.

turns.speaker: SAM
turns.text: What about the "Roaring Twenties" or "The 80's"?

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Guess who I did it with last night...

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Roger in Op/Ed.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Who told!

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: You did. Yesterday you said, and I quote, "I have a date with Roger from Op/Ed tonight and I'm going to do it with him."

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Well, that doesn't mean it was going to happen for sure.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Intra office. And they're not dating. They're having sex.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: And what is your policy? That if you're not getting any, no one can?

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Okay. Remember when they took your office chair in for repairs and forgot to return it?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: You stood for like a month.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: I swear to God, Jos. When is the last time you went on a real live date?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I'm concentrating on my career right now.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Do you own any colored underwear? Stripes? Anything?!

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Anita!

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Look. You're way under 30, you're cute, some guys find white Carter's underwear sexy  If you talk to his nose, you don't even notice the eye.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: The right guy is out there. I'm just not going to kiss a whole bunch of losers to get to him.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Yeah, but sometimes kissing the losers can be a fun diversion.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: When I finally get kissed, I'll know.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Okay. If you've never kissed a guy, we got bigger problems than the underwear.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I've kissed guys. I've just never kissed a guy. Felt that thing--

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: My own undercover feature - "Written by Josie Geller".

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Jos - Maybe you should turn it down.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: You don't think I can do it.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: No - It's just a lot of pressure for your first piece, that's all. I mean, it's not a half-page article, it's a major undercover piece, Jos. Look what Rigfort did to Dutton - and that guy's his cousin!

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Okay, just so I'm clear here -- neither of you think I can do this.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Jos, that's not what we're --

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Anita, when you wanted to seduce the guy in the mailroom and you didn't think you could learn Spanish fast enough, who quizzed you on your verbs?

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Senorita Josie.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: And Gus - when you picked up knitting, who showed you how to hold the needles?

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: So, you were a geek. Big deal.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Anita, remember espadrilles?

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Please. That doesn't make you a nerd. Everyone wore those shoes.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: The girls threw them at me in the locker room.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Okay. That's bad.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: At the end of the yeat the person who got the most direct his to my head got to toss me into the pool.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Mama mia.  Just because you were a nerd once doesn't mean it's going to happen again. That's why you have me for fashion consultation.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Now this is cute.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: That is lingerie.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: So I was thinking about what you were saying - y'know, about really being kissed? I think Roger could be the one.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: What'd you feel when you kissed him?

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Bridgework?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Very romantic.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: How about this?

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: I am not letting you out of the house in that, young lady.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Cuuuute!

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: 'Nita, this is about reporting, not accessorizing.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: And we're going to have to do something about your hair.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Anita!

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Jos, please try and have some fun here, okay? How many of us get to go back to high school? You're gonna have a blast!

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Hi!

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: Josie! Josie, how'd it go? Did he ream you?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Yeah, but I'm okay. I've got some work to do.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: You need my help?

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: No, thanks--I'm doing this on my own.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Wow. It's packed.

turns.speaker: ANITA
turns.text: It's great! They're behind you. They feel like they know you.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: George! What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Just get in the van, Josie.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hidden camera.

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: Wings?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: We used it for our expose on overweight flight attendants--"Is That Why They Never Give You a Second Bag of Nuts?"

turns.speaker: JOSIE
turns.text: I'm not doing this until I speak with Gus.
